description: Ship-safe LOC taxonomy using neutral internal codes. Does not reference ASAM trademarked terminology.

levels.ui_tooltip: Structured program for patients needing more support than outpatient

domain_severity_mapping.description: General guidelines for mapping clinical domain severity to appropriate level of care
domain_severity_mapping.note: These are guidelines only. Clinical judgment and individual patient circumstances override algorithmic recommendations.

severity_levels.0: No risk - any outpatient level appropriate
severity_levels.2: Moderate risk - consider withdrawal management services
severity_levels.3: Severe risk - medically monitored or managed withdrawal required

severity_levels.2: Moderate symptoms - requires daily clinical support

severity_levels.1: Moderate readiness - may need extra support
severity_levels.3: Resistant - requires intensive structure and support

domains.name: Relapse, Continued Use, or Continued Problem Potential

severity_levels.1: Moderate risk - may need IOP or higher
severity_levels.2: High risk - requires residential or higher

severity_levels.1: Some challenges - may need extra support

usage_notes.legal: This taxonomy is proprietary and does not reference ASAM trademarked terms. Safe for shipping without license.
usage_notes.clinical: These codes are for internal system use. Map to external standards (LOINC, SNOMED) when exporting to EMR.
usage_notes.validation: UI should enforce validation rules to prevent inappropriate level of care assignments.
usage_notes.i18n: Display names and tooltips should be localized for multi-language support.
